page.title: 07TRANSPORT
page.content: GIRVAN lies on the main Glasgow to Stranraer railway line.It is fifty miles from Glasgow and thirty from Stranraer,the terminus for the Irish boat to Larne.It is possible to take the boat train direct to London. There is a good road system which has much scenic beauty,particularly south of Girvan as it winds through Glen App and along the shores of Loch Ryan.Traffic can be heavy during the summer months but driving can be avoided by using a good bus service. Some twenty five miles away lies PRESTWICK Airport serving mainly the North Atlantic routes.Glasgow Airport is reasonably accessible with both national and international flights A Girvan by-pass has been discussed for many years but remains a pipe-dream
